etymology.description: 膂 is a variant form of 呂(呂) (lǚ, "spine")
etymology.interpretation: Originating as a pictogram depicting two disconnected blocks, 呂(呂) was initially associated with metal and later reinterpreted as vertebrae through the addition of a connecting line, representing 9 (lǚ, "spine"). The character 呂(呂) was phonetically borrowed for this meaning, while 膂 emphasizes its anatomical sense with the addition of the 肉(肉) (ròu, "flesh") radical.

examples.chinese: 他的膂十分强健(他的膂十分強健)。
练习瑜伽可以增强膂(練習瑜伽可以增強膂)，保持身体健康(保持身體健康)。
examples.pinyin: Liànxí yújiā kěyǐ zēngqiáng lǚ, bǎochí shēntǐ jiànkāng.
examples.english: Practicing yoga can strengthen the spine, helping to maintain a healthy body.
